result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A Kline was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 1 day sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision (to include prison wages/trust accounts).
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Compliance with Sex Offender Registry.
Sex offender treatment.
No unsupervised contact with minor females.
No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint, her family, residence, school or place of employment.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

received  by Atty Schieber Jurss.
From Redgranite Correctional.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Hannah Schieber Jurss appeared by phone means for Defendant Christopher A Kline. 
Defendant Christopher A Kline in court, in custody (by video from Redgranite Correctional), with attorney Hannah Schieber Jurss.    
Oral Ruling On:
Defense Motion to Strike the Sex Registry Requirement (two issues in contest: are lengthy of time for the sex registry requirement, and specific reasons why the court is placing the defendant on the sex registry).

Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds the sex offender registry is not mandatory (on this charge) however, it is within the discretion of the court to be ordered.
Court also finds once the court orders the Sex Offender Registry Requirement, the statute requires registration of 15 years beyond length of sentence (mandated and mandatory by statute).
Once ordered, the court has no jurisdiction to modify/change the statutory requirements.
Therefore, the Court Denies the Defense Motion for Sentence Modification to include a length of time.

Lost the defendant by video - Tried to reconnect and call the contact number numerous time.
Court addressed the issue with Atty. Jurss.
Atty. Jurss would like the court to continue with it's oral ruling.
Court Continued.

Court listed it's reasons for placing the defendant on the record.
Defendant never took responsibility for his actions.
Court is satisfied the reasons placed on the record are sufficient.
Therefore, Court Denies the Defense Motion for Sentence Modification.
Atty. Jurss to file order for the court's signature.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Hannah Schieber Jurss appeared by phone means for Defendant Christopher A Kline. 
Defendant Christopher A Kline in court, in custody (by video conference from Redgranite), with attorney Hannah Schieber Jurss.    
Oral Ruling to address:
Defense Motion to Strike the Sex Registry Requirement.

Tried to get the defendant by video conference, however, upon connection there was empty black room.
Tried to call six different phone numbers at redgranite and got either out of the office messages or voice mail (took 15 minutes).

Court will not proceed with the Oral Ruling without the defendant being presented either by video or in person.
Court will allow Atty. Jurss to appear by phone for the next court date.
Defendant to appear by video for the next court date.

  Oral ruling scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
It is ordered that the time for deciding the defendant's postconviction motion is extended to January 3, 2017
Copy of:  Motion for Extension of Time for Circuit Court  to Issue Decision on Post-Conviction Motion, sent to Court of Appeal by Atty. Hannah Jurss.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher A Kline in court with attorney Mark A. Brellenthin. 

Victim's Mother presented statements to the court.
State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's Mother presented a statement to the court.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's priest presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  8 Years.
Initial Confinement:  4 Years.
Extended Supervision:  4 Years.
1 Day Credit.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Compliance with the sex offender registry.
Sex Offender Treatment.
No unsupervised contact with minor females.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim (listed in the criminal complaint),her family, residence, school or place of employment .
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (to include prison wages/trust accounts).

Defendant is  not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
